N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 325-2.2 - Parties authorized to direct or recommend care of injured workers

State Regulations
(a) For purposes of
this Subpart, direction of care shall mean the binding referral of an injured
employee to a designated network or health care provider as authorized under
the statutory programs set forth in subdivision (b) of this section. Recommendation of a designated network or health care provider shall mean the
act of actively endorsing or promoting the utilization of a designated network
or health care provider for the treatment of an injured employee. (b) Only those parties who are either: (1)
participating in a certified preferred
provider organization (PPO) arrangement under article 10-A of the Workers'
Compensation Law; or
(2)
participating in the alternative dispute resolution pilot program under section
25
(2-c)
of the Workers' Compensation Law may
direct the care of injured employees to a designated network or health care
provider. Only those parties who are complying with the provisions
of sections
13-a
(1)
and
13-i
of the Workers' Compensation Law may recommend a designated network or health
care provider to an injured employee. Notes
